If you ever look at the tracking of a stock over the course of a week you will see the thing go up and done like crazy as it changes. First:
 If you want to get technical, America is a Federal Constitutional Republic who's government operates as a Representative Democracy through the Congressional System. 
 
 In other words, in theory, we are a republic that practices representative democracy. I did not think I needed to be that specific for you, but there you go. 
 
 Second:
 I understand how the electoral college works. I understand why we came up with the idea of using the electoral college (though we did not think of it). I understand how the votes are counted, and the role that electors play in the process. I do not like a system that could in theory allow (and has 2 possibly 3 times [4 if you count 1824]) someone to win the popular vote, yet lose the electoral vote and not become president. If 21,000,000 people vote for X, and 21,000,001 vote for Y, Y should win. And I guess I should not say that not every vote is counted. In theory, every vote is counted....but not every vote matters (winner take all concept). Also, the electoral college plays to and protects a 2 party system, leaving little hope of ever getting anything other than the tradiitional Republican / Democrat trash that we have seen for the last 30 years who are too busy arguing over party lines than to actually work together to accomplish anythying. 
 
 Third:
 I did not call for getting rid of the presidency, senate, congress, or anything else for that matter other than the electoral college. Just because I do not like the way we vote does not mean that I do not believe in the insitutions we vote for. There is a distinction...one that I am sure you are both smart enough to understand. 
 
 Fourth: 
 I general, the American public is ignorant to the political system in this country, and how we actually put poeple in office. Moreover, the American public by large is uneducated about who we are putting into office. I know and have met many people who simply go and vote straight ticket, or vote for who their church says to vote for...or who their boss says they should vote for...or who the AARP says they should vote for. Many people do not take the time to educate themselves about the issues, the candidates, and where the candidates stand on the issues. I want no part of this red and blue 2 ring circus. I would rather waste my time on this forum telling you why I will not waste my time going to vote. :)

 You obviously don't understand anything about the structure of our government. The States, sovereign entities of themselves, have constitutional rights just as the people do. The President is a representative of neither. The House of Representatives represents the people and the Senate represents the States. It is the Presidents job to execute what those two branches direct him to do, not to simply serve one or the other. That is why the electoral college was devised, to balance the rights of the people with those of the States to yield an executor equally selected by both.
